abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Regional Health Emergency Response Project for Iraq is to
            assist the Kurdistan Regional Government to build capacity
            in the establishment of rapid, coordinated and effective
            response services to health emergencies, including those
            resulting from acts of violence, accidents, or natural
            disasters. This is a second level restructuring to include
            an additional method of procurement to the grant agreement
            for the project as per the request of the Ministry of Health
            of the Regional Government of Kurdistan (KRG MOH) dated
            January 4, 2012. The original grant for the above project
            was approved on June 19, 2008 for US$8.7 million, with
            additional financing for US$4.5 million approved on June 30,
            2010. The project is at 80 percent physical completion, with
            the disbursement level at 82 percent. The project is rated
            as moderately satisfactory, with the near completion and
            functionality of the Emergency Coordination Centers (ECCs),
            the installation of the CAD/AVL (emergency tracking system),
            and the installation of radio towers. All blood banks have
            been completed, equipped, and is operational, except for the
            Erbil Blood Bank which has settlement cracks in the facility
            which need to be remedied prior to being operational. Data
            for collection and use of blood for emergency purposes is
            currently being collected. Other project data such as
            response time using the new system and registration of
            incoming calls, will be collected in February 2012 once the
            Emergency Coordination Centers (ECCs) are operational.
